isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - ADJUSTMENTS - WIPER ARM AND BLADE

svcprocinfo.para: To adjust the wiper arm and blade on the windshield for roof or cowl mounted windshield wipers, use the following procedure.

svcsubproc.title: Roof Mounted Wiper Arm and Blade With Air Wipers

step1.para: With the windshield wipers off and in the park position, remove the wiper arm and blade ( Item 9, Figure 99) as follows.
Remove the acorn nut and lockwasher ( Items 1 and 2, Figure 99) securing the wiper arm and blade ( Item 9, Figure 99) to the serrated drive bushing and remove the wiper arm and blade.

caution.para: Do not pound on or pry on the wiper arm. Use an appropriate puller to remove it.

step1.para: Position the wiper arm and blade ( Item 1, Figure 115) at the serrated drive bushing so the park position of the wiper blade pivot, the point where dimension ( Item A, Figure 115) is measured, is 1 inch (25.4 mm) below the weather seal ( Item 2, Figure 115). Push the wiper arm and blade onto the serrated drive bushing.
Install the lockwasher and acorn nut ( Items 2 and 1, Figure 99) and tighten to 54 to 62 in-lbs. (6 to 7 Nm).

note.para: Water sprayed on the windshield may help to determine the wiper pattern.

step1.para: Turn the wipers on to high speed and check the wiper pattern. Make sure the wipers do not run off the glass.

calloutgroup.callout1: A. 1 INCH (25.4 MM) FOR AIR WIPERS 1.5 INCHES (38 MM) FOR ELECTRIC WIPERS

svcsubproc.title: Roof Mounted Wiper Arm and Blade With Electric Wipers

step1.para: With the windshield wipers off and in the park position, remove the wiper arm and blade ( Item 9, Figure 99) as follows.
Remove the acorn nut and lockwasher ( Items 1 and 2, Figure 99) securing the wiper arm and blade ( Item 9, Figure 99) to the knurled driver and remove the wiper arm and blade.

caution.para: Do not pound on or pry on the wiper arm. Use an appropriate puller to remove it.

step1.para: Position the wiper arm and blade ( Item 1, Figure 115) at the knurled driver on the wiper pivot. Align the wiper arm and blade so park position of the wiper blade pivot, the point where dimension ( Item A, Figure 115) is measured, is 1.5 inches (38 mm) below the weather seal ( Item 2, Figure 115). Push the wiper arm and blade onto the knurled driver.
Install the lockwasher and acorn nut ( Items 2 and 1, Figure 99) and tighten to 54 to 62 in-lbs. (6 to 7 Nm).

note.para: Water sprayed on the windshield may help to determine the wiper pattern.

step1.para: Turn the wipers on to high speed and check the wiper pattern. Make sure the wipers do not run off the glass.

svcsubproc.title: Cowl Mounted Wiper Arm and Blade With Electric Wipers

step1.para: Remove the wiper arm and blade ( Item 1, Figure 116) from wiper pivot assembly.

caution.para: Do not pound on or pry on the wiper arm. Use an appropriate puller to remove it.

step1.para: Position the wiper arm and blade ( Item 1, Figure 116) at the wiper pivot assembly serrations so the park position of the wiper blade pivot, the point where dimension ( Item A, Figure 116) is measured, is 1.5 inches (38 mm) above the windshield weather seal ( Item 2, Figure 116). Push on tight.

note.para: Water sprayed on the windshield may help to determine the wiper pattern.

step1.para: Turn the wipers on to high speed and check the wiper pattern. Make sure the wipers do not run off the glass.
